security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation review skill. Contains only markdown instructions, checklists, and feedback templates. No executable code, no network calls, no file system manipulation beyond standard platform tools, no environment access, and no external command execution. This is a low-risk documentation tool.

content.value_statement: Documentation reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent when done manually. This skill automates compliance checks against a style guide, catching tone, structure, formatting, and clarity issues in markdown files with consistent numbered feedback.
actual_capabilities: Check markdown files for formal or corporate tone violations
Identify structure issues like buried important information or vague headings
Detect formatting problems including ampersands as 'and' and inconsistent lists
Review links for descriptive anchor text instead of 'click here'
Flag code examples that would error or commands not in execution order
Output numbered issues with suggested fixes in markdown format
limitations: Does not modify files or make automatic fixes
Only reviews markdown documentation, not code or configuration
Requires the style guide file to be available for reference
Does not validate technical accuracy of documentation content

use_cases.title: Documentation PR reviews
use_cases.description: Review pull requests for documentation changes and ensure style guide compliance before merging

use_cases.title: Contributor submissions
use_cases.description: Check incoming documentation contributions from community contributors for consistent tone and formatting

use_cases.title: Style enforcement
use_cases.description: Maintain documentation consistency across a codebase with automated style checking

prompt_templates.title: Quick scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to scan this markdown file for quick style issues.

prompt_templates.title: Full review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill to perform a full review of this documentation against the style guide.

prompt_templates.title: PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the docs-review skill in PR mode to review all documentation changes in this pull request.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the docs-review skill with the complete checklist to audit this documentation for tone, structure, formatting, links, code examples, and sentence construction.

output_examples.input: Review this documentation file for style compliance
output: Issue 1: Formal tone - Line 12: Consider using 'use' instead of 'utilize' for clearer communication
Issue 2: Vague heading - Line 8: Heading 'Process' could be more specific. Try 'Run migrations before upgrading'
Issue 3: Link text - Line 25: 'Click here' should be descriptive link text like 'View the installation guide'

best_practices: Number all issues sequentially so authors can reference and track fixes efficiently
Only flag issues that make a material difference to the reader
Use PR review mode when the GitHub MCP tool is available for structured feedback
anti_patterns: Flagging trivial style nitpicks that do not improve readability
Skipping issues that violate the style guide because they seem minor
Outputting issues without line numbers or specific file references

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires Read, Grep, Bash, and Glob tools for file access.

faq.question: Does this skill modify files?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reads files and outputs feedback. All fixes must be applied manually by the user.

faq.question: Can this skill review any markdown file?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can review any markdown documentation. Best results when the Metabase style guide is available.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only processes documentation locally. No data is sent to external services or stored elsewhere.

faq.question: What if the review finds no issues?
faq.answer: The skill will output a confirmation message indicating no style violations were found.

faq.question: How is this different from markdown linters?
faq.answer: This skill checks writing style and tone beyond syntax. It catches corporate language, vague headings, and readability issues that linters miss.
